HDG.ID.content: [by Stambaugh] German idealists place identity in center of their thought, not concerned w/ simple unity of thing w/ itself, but w/ mediated syntheses of subject/object

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.ID.content: difference stems from essence of identity [reverse of Derrida?]
HDG.ID.linkedContent: difference stems from essence of identity [reverse of Derrida?]

HDG.ID.content: idem, to auto > for something to be the same, one is always enough: “plant is a plant” is a tautology [Schelling?] > principle of identity (considered highest principle of thought), A = A speaks of equality, doesn’t define A as the same, conceals what principle is trying to say: A is A, every A is itself the same

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

HDG.ID.linkedContent: idem, to auto > for something to be the same, one is always enough: “plant is a plant” is a tautology [Schelling?] > principle of identity (considered highest principle of thought), A = A speaks of equality, doesn’t define A as the same, conceals what principle is trying to say: A is A, every A is itself the same

HDG.ID.content: German idealism, where abode (Unterkunft) [compare to arrival] is found for radiant emergence of mediation w/in identity, abode for synthetic essence of identity
HDG.ID.linkedContent: German idealism, where abode (Unterkunft) [compare to arrival] is found for radiant emergence of mediation w/in identity, abode for synthetic essence of identity

HDG.ID.content: principle of identity, A is A, this “is” tells us how every being is: it itself is same w/ itself > principle of identity speaks of Being of beings [heard in its fundamental key (Grundton)]
HDG.ID.linkedContent: principle of identity, A is A, this “is” tells us how every being is: it itself is same w/ itself > principle of identity speaks of Being of beings [heard in its fundamental key (Grundton)]

HDG.ID.content: wherever we are related (verhalten) [restrain, behave] to beings of every kind, identity makes its claim on us (angesprochen) > science needs identity as assurance
HDG.ID.linkedContent: wherever we are related (verhalten) [restrain, behave] to beings of every kind, identity makes its claim on us (angesprochen) > science needs identity as assurance

HDG.ID.content: [science can’t really use principle of identity]
retrace our steps, step back: what does appropriation have to do w/ identity?
HDG.ID.linkedContent: retrace our steps, step back: what does appropriation have to do w/ identity?

HDG.ID.content: essence of identity is property of Ereignis > a departure from Being as ground of beings that springs into abyss, but not empty nothingness, this abyss is Ereignis > principle of identity means a spring required by essence of identity to attain essential light of Ereignis > Ereignis vibrates active nature of what speaks as language, once called House of Being [dissemination?]

HDG.ID.linkedContent: essence of identity is property of Ereignis > a departure from Being as ground of beings that springs into abyss, but not empty nothingness, this abyss is Ereignis > principle of identity means a spring required by essence of identity to attain essential light of Ereignis > Ereignis vibrates active nature of what speaks as language, once called House of Being [dissemination?]

HDG.FS.content: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: formal logic foundation of transcendental logic? or vice versa? > difference/relation btwn formal Logic/transcendental Logic = difference/relation btwn ordinary principle/speculative principle (Satz) [on difficulty of determining highest principle in Fichte, that of identity or that of positing non-Ego?]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general

HDG.FS.content: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”

HDG.FS.content: for Heidegger, identity of being/nothing thought in departure (im Ausgang) from ontological difference [departure as from or as leaving behind? cf. 58 departure from Being] > [Hegel thinks this identity w/out concern for ontological difference]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Heidegger, identity of being/nothing thought in departure (im Ausgang) from ontological difference [departure as from or as leaving behind? cf. 58 departure from Being] > [Hegel thinks this identity w/out concern for ontological difference]

HDG.FS.content: [phono-logocentrism in Heidegger] “Principle of Identity” better heard than read
